channel.title: Ziff Davis
channel.description: Ziff Davis (Nasdaq: ZD) is a vertically focused digital media and internet company whose portfolio includes leading brands in technology, entertainment, shopping, health, cybersecurity, and martech.

item.title: Cash Back Day: Amazon, Walmart, Lowe’s and others helping consumers earn money
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
"RetailMeNot is putting cash back into shoppers' pockets to relieve some of the challenges they’ll be facing this season, and our Cash Back Day event is a prime opportunity to get ahead of the holiday shopping hustle and enjoy savings in the form of cash back for later purchases," RetailMeNot shopping expert Kristin McGrath said in a statement.

The post Cash Back Day: Amazon, Walmart, Lowe’s and others helping consumers earn money appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“RetailMeNot is putting cash back into shoppers’ pockets to relieve some of the challenges they’ll be facing this season, and our Cash Back Day event is a prime opportunity to get ahead of the holiday shopping hustle and enjoy savings in the form of cash back for later purchases,” RetailMeNot shopping expert Kristin McGrath said in a statement.

The post Cash Back Day: Amazon, Walmart, Lowe’s and others helping consumers earn money appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: 20 best November deals: Shop Thanksgiving, Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
The end of the month will be full of Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales on a wide variety of product categories. Kristin McGrath, shopping editor at RetailMeNot, said that the November sales events are “one of the best times all year” to buy apparel, toys, makeup, tech and home goods. McGrath advised that shoppers don’t need to wait until Black Friday itself to shop. Retailers may begin launching sales a few days before Thanksgiving, or even earlier in the month, so shoppers should begin to check for early deals online and plan to start shopping early.

The post 20 best November deals: Shop Thanksgiving, Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
The end of the month will be full of Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales on a wide variety of product categories. Kristin McGrath, shopping editor at RetailMeNot, said that the November sales events are “one of the best times all year” to buy apparel, toys, makeup, tech and home goods. McGrath advised that shoppers don’t need to wait until Black Friday itself to shop. Retailers may begin launching sales a few days before Thanksgiving, or even earlier in the month, so shoppers should begin to check for early deals online and plan to start shopping early.

The post 20 best November deals: Shop Thanksgiving, Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Move Over, Cox: New Data Reveals Spectrum as the Fastest Internet Provider
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
The newest Ookla Speedtest Intelligence report, released this week, has tabbed Spectrum as the fastest fixed broadband provider among top US internet service providers, with Spectrum grabbing the spot from Cox, which held it earlier in the year. Spectrum clocked in at a median download speed of 211.66 megabits per second compared with 196.52Mbps for Cox.

The post Move Over, Cox: New Data Reveals Spectrum as the Fastest Internet Provider appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
The newest Ookla Speedtest Intelligence report, released this week, has tabbed Spectrum as the fastest fixed broadband provider among top US internet service providers, with Spectrum grabbing the spot from Cox, which held it earlier in the year. Spectrum clocked in at a median download speed of 211.66 megabits per second compared with 196.52Mbps for Cox.

The post Move Over, Cox: New Data Reveals Spectrum as the Fastest Internet Provider appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: With Moms Still Stressed Out, Marketers Must Tread Lightly
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
With their stress levels rising post-pandemic, pregnant women and mothers of young children want ads and other content directed at them to showcase real moms (65%), be relatable (63%), be educational and informational (61%), and be uplifting/positive (55%). That’s according to a study of over 3,000 women conducted by Ziff Davis’ Everyday Health Group Pregnancy & Parenting (EHG P&P), which runs the BabyCenter and What to Expect platforms.

The post With Moms Still Stressed Out, Marketers Must Tread Lightly appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
With their stress levels rising post-pandemic, pregnant women and mothers of young children want ads and other content directed at them to showcase real moms (65%), be relatable (63%), be educational and informational (61%), and be uplifting/positive (55%). That’s according to a study of over 3,000 women conducted by Ziff Davis’ Everyday Health Group Pregnancy & Parenting (EHG P&P), which runs the BabyCenter and What to Expect platforms.

The post With Moms Still Stressed Out, Marketers Must Tread Lightly appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: As Pandemic Recedes, Moms Report Feeling More Pressure Rather Than Less, According to Research From Everyday Health Group Pregnancy & Parenting
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
“We’d assumed mom would begin feeling less anxious as pandemic restrictions lifted, but these findings tell us a different story,” said Christine Mattheis, Vice President, Editorial Director, EHG P&P. “Instead, moms are just as stressed out today as they were back in April 2020, with inflation, isolation, and the cost of raising a baby fueling their anxiety.”

The post As Pandemic Recedes, Moms Report Feeling More Pressure Rather Than Less, According to Research From Everyday Health Group Pregnancy & Parenting appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“We’d assumed mom would begin feeling less anxious as pandemic restrictions lifted, but these findings tell us a different story,” said Christine Mattheis, Vice President, Editorial Director, EHG P&P. “Instead, moms are just as stressed out today as they were back in April 2020, with inflation, isolation, and the cost of raising a baby fueling their anxiety.”

The post As Pandemic Recedes, Moms Report Feeling More Pressure Rather Than Less, According to Research From Everyday Health Group Pregnancy & Parenting appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: IGN Acquires Agency 1TwentyFour in Brand Partnership Push
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
“Our combined vision is for 1TwentyFour to continue supporting and growing their current portfolio with full access to our reach and data while also bringing their services into the mix across the entire IGN portfolio to support the ongoing growth of the business,” said Yael Prough, Executive Vice President and General Manager at IGN.

The post IGN Acquires Agency 1TwentyFour in Brand Partnership Push appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“Our combined vision is for 1TwentyFour to continue supporting and growing their current portfolio with full access to our reach and data while also bringing their services into the mix across the entire IGN portfolio to support the ongoing growth of the business,” said Yael Prough, Executive Vice President and General Manager at IGN.

item.title: “To be a force for good in gaming – this is a little bit of redemption.” Humble Games boss Alan Patmore on his mission
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
"I think the coolest part is the relationship we have with charities... the impact that the Humble community is having on people...This is the most mission-driven company I’ve ever worked at, and the most value-driven company I’ve ever worked at. And that is incredibly rewarding." - Alan Patmore, Executive Vice President and General Manager, Humble Bundle

The post “To be a force for good in gaming – this is a little bit of redemption.” Humble Games boss Alan Patmore on his mission appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Security to take an outsized role in IT spending in 2023
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Security is taking an outsized role in technology spending and is expected to creep into software, hardware and cloud budgets in 2023, according to Spiceworks Ziff Davis survey of more than 1,400 IT professionals...“If you look across all of these categories, security is a line item in all of them,” Peter Tsai, senior technology analyst at Spiceworks Ziff Davis, said Wednesday during a SpiceWorld 2022 panel. “If you add all of them up, security is one of the top standing areas overall.”

The post Security to take an outsized role in IT spending in 2023 appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Security is taking an outsized role in technology spending and is expected to creep into software, hardware and cloud budgets in 2023, according to Spiceworks Ziff Davis survey of more than 1,400 IT professionals…“If you look across all of these categories, security is a line item in all of them,” Peter Tsai, senior technology analyst at Spiceworks Ziff Davis, said Wednesday during a SpiceWorld 2022 panel. “If you add all of them up, security is one of the top standing areas overall.”

The post Security to take an outsized role in IT spending in 2023 appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Best new tech items to keep on your radar for fall 2022: Apple Airpods Pro, Google Pixel 7 and more
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Traditionally, tech buys and gadgets tend to be on the higher end when it comes to pricing, but RetailMeNot's shopping expert Kristin McGrath told "GMA" a helpful way to save is to start looking early. "Over the past few years, we've seen retailers offering Black Friday pricing on select products in October. And, this year, Target's Deal Days event is taking place Oct. 6-8 and Amazon's Prime Early Access event the week after — making these great opportunities to check tech off your list early and avoid the short supply and longer shipping times we might see later in the season."

The post Best new tech items to keep on your radar for fall 2022: Apple Airpods Pro, Google Pixel 7 and more appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Traditionally, tech buys and gadgets tend to be on the higher end when it comes to pricing, but RetailMeNot’s shopping expert Kristin McGrath told “GMA” a helpful way to save is to start looking early. “Over the past few years, we’ve seen retailers offering Black Friday pricing on select products in October. And, this year, Target’s Deal Days event is taking place Oct. 6-8 and Amazon’s Prime Early Access event the week after — making these great opportunities to check tech off your list early and avoid the short supply and longer shipping times we might see later in the season.”

The post Best new tech items to keep on your radar for fall 2022: Apple Airpods Pro, Google Pixel 7 and more appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Budget cuts will spare IT heading into 2023
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
“In hard economic times, you would expect companies to pull back and you would expect those pullbacks to include IT,” said Peter Tsai, senior technology analyst at Spiceworks Ziff Davis. “The big surprise is that spending on IT is expected to increase even among companies that are actively cutting back elsewhere to prepare for a recession.”

The post Budget cuts will spare IT heading into 2023 appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“In hard economic times, you would expect companies to pull back and you would expect those pullbacks to include IT,” said Peter Tsai, senior technology analyst at Spiceworks Ziff Davis. “The big surprise is that spending on IT is expected to increase even among companies that are actively cutting back elsewhere to prepare for a recession.”

The post Budget cuts will spare IT heading into 2023 appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Spiceworks Ziff Davis 2023 State of IT Report Counters Recession Fears with Projected Tech Budget Growth
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Spiceworks Ziff Davis (SWZD) published findings in its annual 2023 State of IT report — exploring IT budget plans and tech trends to uncover areas of growth for tech vendors and empower buyers with data to inform strategies for navigating an uncertain market. Although 83% of businesses are concerned about a recession in 2023, B2B tech marketers can look forward to growth — 51% of organizations plan to increase IT budgets in 2023 vs. a narrow 6% that plan to reduce their spend.

The post Spiceworks Ziff Davis 2023 State of IT Report Counters Recession Fears with Projected Tech Budget Growth appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Spiceworks Ziff Davis (SWZD) published findings in its annual 2023 State of IT report — exploring IT budget plans and tech trends to uncover areas of growth for tech vendors and empower buyers with data to inform strategies for navigating an uncertain market. Although 83% of businesses are concerned about a recession in 2023, B2B tech marketers can look forward to growth — 51% of organizations plan to increase IT budgets in 2023 vs. a narrow 6% that plan to reduce their spend.

The post Spiceworks Ziff Davis 2023 State of IT Report Counters Recession Fears with Projected Tech Budget Growth appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Health eCareers Announces Partnership With TopResume
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
"We are excited to partner with TopResume to provide job seekers access to the highest-quality resume- and CV-review and writing services," said Health eCareers managing director Greg Chang. "In addition to discovering the best career opportunities through Health eCareers extensive job network with the nation's top employers, healthcare professionals can now better position themselves for the best roles across the industry by tailoring their resume or CV with expertise from TopResume."

The post Health eCareers Announces Partnership With TopResume appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“We are excited to partner with TopResume to provide job seekers access to the highest-quality resume- and CV-review and writing services,” said Health eCareers managing director Greg Chang. “In addition to discovering the best career opportunities through Health eCareers extensive job network with the nation’s top employers, healthcare professionals can now better position themselves for the best roles across the industry by tailoring their resume or CV with expertise from TopResume.”

The post Health eCareers Announces Partnership With TopResume appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Group Black Expands Board with Industry Titans to Further the Mission to Dramatically Change the Face of Media Ownership and Investment
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
"Group Black is a trailblazer in our industry. By partnering with leading media companies and scaling Black-owned brands, Group Black is forging a path to democratizing the media industry," said Ziff Davis CEO Vivek Shah. "I'm excited to be part of this important effort to diversify the media ecosystem."

The post Group Black Expands Board with Industry Titans to Further the Mission to Dramatically Change the Face of Media Ownership and Investment appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“Group Black is a trailblazer in our industry. By partnering with leading media companies and scaling Black-owned brands, Group Black is forging a path to democratizing the media industry,” said Ziff Davis CEO Vivek Shah. “I’m excited to be part of this important effort to diversify the media ecosystem.”

The post Group Black Expands Board with Industry Titans to Further the Mission to Dramatically Change the Face of Media Ownership and Investment appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Queen will have ‘rare’ impact on baby name chart following death, claims expert
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Reflecting on current trends, Sarah Redshaw, Managing Editor at BabyCenter, revealed the name Elizabeth has been making something of a comeback...Up until a few years ago it appeared to be in decline, with the name failing to make it the 2020 chart of top 100 girls' names compiled by BabyCenter..."But more recently, the name has started gaining popularity. In the first half of this year, and in the lead up to the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee celebrations, it had risen to 84 in our list of most popular names," revealed Redshaw.

The post Queen will have ‘rare’ impact on baby name chart following death, claims expert appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Reflecting on current trends, Sarah Redshaw, Managing Editor at BabyCenter, revealed the name Elizabeth has been making something of a comeback…Up until a few years ago it appeared to be in decline, with the name failing to make it the 2020 chart of top 100 girls’ names compiled by BabyCenter…”But more recently, the name has started gaining popularity. In the first half of this year, and in the lead up to the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee celebrations, it had risen to 84 in our list of most popular names,” revealed Redshaw.

The post Queen will have ‘rare’ impact on baby name chart following death, claims expert appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Having a baby? The first year can easily set you back nearly $16,000. Add that to recession fears, rising prices and job insecurity.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
The study by BabyCenter, which calculated costs based on a variety of items needed for a baby, from childcare and formula to diapers and bibs and clothing, found that a baby’s first year could cost parents on average $15,775. The biggest expense during a baby’s first year is childcare, which roughly costs about $6,500.

The post Having a baby? The first year can easily set you back nearly $16,000. Add that to recession fears, rising prices and job insecurity. appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
The study by BabyCenter, which calculated costs based on a variety of items needed for a baby, from childcare and formula to diapers and bibs and clothing, found that a baby’s first year could cost parents on average $15,775. The biggest expense during a baby’s first year is childcare, which roughly costs about $6,500.

The post Having a baby? The first year can easily set you back nearly $16,000. Add that to recession fears, rising prices and job insecurity. appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Here’s What Consumers Plan to Buy on Labor Day Weekend
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Labor Day sales typically focus on big ticket items...But as inflation has slashed discretionary spending, a RetailMeNot survey of more than 1,000 shoppers shows most plan to focus on the essentials this year...59% of respondents will be looking for deals during the holiday weekend and intend to spend an average of $178. In addition, 54% of shoppers said they’ll buy food and drinks, and 42% are looking to pick up clothing.

The post Here’s What Consumers Plan to Buy on Labor Day Weekend appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Labor Day sales typically focus on big ticket items…But as inflation has slashed discretionary spending, a RetailMeNot survey of more than 1,000 shoppers shows most plan to focus on the essentials this year…59% of respondents will be looking for deals during the holiday weekend and intend to spend an average of $178. In addition, 54% of shoppers said they’ll buy food and drinks, and 42% are looking to pick up clothing.

The post Here’s What Consumers Plan to Buy on Labor Day Weekend appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: VIPRE Security Group Earns Top Marks in AV-Comparatives® Business Security Test
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
“At VIPRE, we understand that the threat landscape is ever-changing, and users need to be constantly vigilant to protect themselves, their customers, and their business,” said VIPRE Security Group’s chief product officer Usman Choudhary. “We decided to take part in AV-Comparatives’ Business Security Test to ensure our products can constantly meet the needs and expectations of our customers, and we are thrilled by the results.

The post VIPRE Security Group Earns Top Marks in AV-Comparatives® Business Security Test appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Inflation Is Schooling Back-to-School Shopping Budgets
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
According to RetailMeNot's recent survey...40% of respondents were stressed about the money they will spend on back-to-school shopping—that’s up from 28% in 2021...“With inflation tightening budgets, consumers are shopping smarter and prioritizing different categories than we saw in 2021,” said Kristin McGrath, RetailMeNot’s shopping expert. “While electronics might be the biggest budget line item this year, it’s the smaller things that are this year’s most popular buys: School supplies, clothes and shoes make up the big three items for this year’s back-to-school shoppers.”

The post Inflation Is Schooling Back-to-School Shopping Budgets appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
According to RetailMeNot’s recent survey…40% of respondents were stressed about the money they will spend on back-to-school shopping—that’s up from 28% in 2021…“With inflation tightening budgets, consumers are shopping smarter and prioritizing different categories than we saw in 2021,” said Kristin McGrath, RetailMeNot’s shopping expert. “While electronics might be the biggest budget line item this year, it’s the smaller things that are this year’s most popular buys: School supplies, clothes and shoes make up the big three items for this year’s back-to-school shoppers.”

The post Inflation Is Schooling Back-to-School Shopping Budgets appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Health eCareers Launches 50th State Nursing Newsletter

The post Health eCareers Launches 50th State Nursing Newsletter appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Humble Bundle’s Choice membership is a great way to build a massive library of PC games for cheap — here’s why it’s worth $12 a month
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
As a long-time Humble Choice member, I've become one for life. Not only have I been able to download games that I'd been wanting, but I've also found many fantastic new titles that I wouldn't have bought otherwise...It also feels great to know that my monthly fee supports a good cause.

item.title: Ziff Davis Reports Second Quarter 2022 Results & Revises Full Year 2022 Guidance
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
"We continue to skillfully navigate a difficult and challenging operating environment with a strategy of producing near-term earnings growth while positioning the company for an eventual macro-economic recovery," said Vivek Shah, Chief Executive Officer of Ziff Davis. "At the same time, we continue to strengthen our balance sheet as we seek acquisition opportunities that enhance our businesses and grow and diversify our revenue streams."

The post Ziff Davis Reports Second Quarter 2022 Results & Revises Full Year 2022 Guidance appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“We continue to skillfully navigate a difficult and challenging operating environment with a strategy of producing near-term earnings growth while positioning the company for an eventual macro-economic recovery,” said Vivek Shah, Chief Executive Officer of Ziff Davis. “At the same time, we continue to strengthen our balance sheet as we seek acquisition opportunities that enhance our businesses and grow and diversify our revenue streams.”

The post Ziff Davis Reports Second Quarter 2022 Results & Revises Full Year 2022 Guidance appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: Companies remain bullish on IT spend, unfazed by financial headwinds
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
Nearly nine in 10 companies surveyed for forthcoming Spiceworks Ziff Davis “2023: State of IT” report are planning for a recession in the next year, according to preliminary findings released Thursday. While half of the nearly 1,500 IT decision makers surveyed saw spending cuts on the horizon, 51% said enterprise IT investments will increase over the next year and only 6% are expecting a decrease.

The post Companies remain bullish on IT spend, unfazed by financial headwinds appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly nine in 10 companies surveyed for forthcoming Spiceworks Ziff Davis “2023: State of IT” report are planning for a recession in the next year, according to preliminary findings released Thursday. While half of the nearly 1,500 IT decision makers surveyed saw spending cuts on the horizon, 51% said enterprise IT investments will increase over the next year and only 6% are expecting a decrease.

The post Companies remain bullish on IT spend, unfazed by financial headwinds appeared first on Ziff Davis.

item.title: VIPRE Security Group Introduces its Latest Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Technology
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
item.description:
“At VIPRE, we know there are a variety of endpoint detection and response products available in the marketplace for large companies, but those solutions can be complex and overwhelming for small and mid-sized businesses. After listening to our clients about their priorities, we decided to focus on creating a solution that would make EDR accessible for SMBs and our partners who serve them,” said VIPRE’s Chief Product Officer Usman Choudhary.

The post VIPRE Security Group Introduces its Latest Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Technology appeared first on Ziff Davis.
item.content:encoded:
“At VIPRE, we know there are a variety of endpoint detection and response products available in the marketplace for large companies, but those solutions can be complex and overwhelming for small and mid-sized businesses. After listening to our clients about their priorities, we decided to focus on creating a solution that would make EDR accessible for SMBs and our partners who serve them,” said VIPRE’s Chief Product Officer Usman Choudhary.

The post VIPRE Security Group Introduces its Latest Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Technology appeared first on Ziff Davis.
